TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataContractJsonSerializer extends System.Object
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataContractJsonSerializer extends System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer
Public NotInheritable Class DataContractJsonSerializer Inherits XmlObjectSerializer

summary.span: 将对象序列化为 JavaScript 对象表示法 (JSON)，并将 JSON 数据反序列化为对象。

span.span: Serializes objects to the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) and deserializes JSON data to objects.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于涉及序列化到 JSON 并从 JSON 反序列化的大多数方案，我们建议在 [System.Text.Js上命名空间中的 api](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-overview)。For most scenarios that involve serializing to JSON and deserializing from JSON, we recommend the [APIs in the System.Text.Json namespace](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-overview). 如果方案需要 类，可以使用它将类型的实例序列化为 json 文档，并将 JSON 文档反序列化为类型的实例。If your scenario requires the class, you can use it to serialize instances of a type into a JSON document and to deserialize a JSON document into an instance of a type. 例如，可以使用包含重要数据（如名称和地址）的属性创建一个名为 `Person` 的类型。For example, you can create a type named `Person` with properties that contain essential data, such as a name and address. 然后，可以创建和操作一个 `Person` 类实例，并在 JSON 文档中写入所有其属性值以便于以后检索。You can then create and manipulate an instance of the `Person` class and write all of its property values in a JSON document for later retrieval. 可随后将该 JSON 文档反序列化为 `Person` 类，或者反序列化为另一个具有等效数据协定的类。This JSON document can later be deserialized into the `Person` class or another class with an equivalent data contract. 如果在服务器上的传出答复的序列化期间发生错误或答复操作由于某种其他原因引发异常，则可能不会将其作为错误返回到客户端。If an error occurs during the serialization of an outgoing reply on the server or the reply operation throws an exception for some other reason, it may not get returned to the client as a fault.

exception.span: 至少有一个正在序列化或反序列化的类型不符合数据协定规则。

span.span: At least one of the types being serialized or deserialized does not conform to data contract rules.

exception.span: 例如， 特性未应用于该类型。

span.span: For example, the attribute has not been applied to the type.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

summary.span: 获取给定 实例的当前活动代理项类型。

span.span: Gets a surrogate type that is currently active for a given instance.

summary.span: 代理项可以扩展序列化或反序列化过程。

span.span: Surrogates can extend the serialization or deserialization process.
An implementation of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可用于自定义序列化和反序列化类型实例的方式。The can be used to customize how instances of a type are serialized and deserialized. 例如，可以使用它为无法序列化的旧类型（即尚未应用 属性的类型）启用序列化。For example, it can be used to enable serialization of legacy types that are not serializable, that is, types to which the attribute has not been applied.

span.span: The format of the date and time type items in object graph.

value.span: 若要忽略未知数据和 ，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: to ignore unknown data and ; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性 (Property) 影响应用了 属性 (Attribute) 的类型，并且还实现了 接口。The property affects types to which a attribute has been applied and that also implement the interface. 在这种情况下，如果 为 `true`，在读取和写入时将忽略在协定的将来版本中添加的数据。In this case when is `true`, data added in future versions of the contract is ignored on read and write. 有关详细信息，请参阅[向前兼容的数据协定](/dotnet/framework/wcf/feature-details/forward-compatible-data-contracts)。For more information, see [Forward-Compatible Data Contracts](/dotnet/framework/wcf/feature-details/forward-compatible-data-contracts).

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指定序列化程序是否可以读取对象。

span.span: Gets a value that specifies whether the serializer can read the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool IsStartObject (System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsStartObject(class System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader) cil managed
Public Overrides Function IsStartObject (reader As XmlDictionaryReader) As Boolean
public: override bool IsStartObject(System::Xml::XmlDictionaryReader ^ reader);
override this.IsStartObject : System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader -> bool

param.name: reader
param.span: 用于读取从 JSON 映射的 XML 流的 。

span.span: The used to read the XML stream mapped from JSON.

summary.span: 获取一个值，指定 是否定位在 XML 元素上，而该元素表示序列化程序可从中进行反序列化的对象。

span.span: Gets a value that specifies whether the is positioned over an XML element that represents an object the serializer can deserialize from.

returns.span: 如果正确定位了读取器，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the reader is positioned correctly; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过检查其是否定位在 XML 元素上，确定其能否读取某个对象。The determines whether it can read a object by checking that it is positioned on an XML element. 它还检查读取器所在的 XML 元素的名称和命名空间，并将这些值与预期的名称和命名空间进行比较。It also examines the name and namespace of the XML element that the reader is positioned at and compares the values to the expected name and namespace. 可以使用传入构造函数的 `rootName` 值（如果存在）来设置预期的名称；如果不存在，则为“root”。The expected name can be set with the `rootName` value passed into the constructor (if present), or is "root" if absent. 预期的命名空间为空字符串。The expected namespace is the empty string. 请注意，此方法适用于使用从 JSON 映射的 XML 的高级方案。Note that this method is intended for advanced scenarios when working with XML mapped from JSON.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool IsStartObject (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsStartObject(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader) cil managed
Public Overrides Function IsStartObject (reader As XmlReader) As Boolean
public: override bool IsStartObject(System::Xml::XmlReader ^ reader);
override this.IsStartObject : System.Xml.XmlReader -> bool

param.name: reader
param.span: 用于读取 XML 流的 。

span.span: The used to read the XML stream.

summary.span: 确定是否将 定位在可反序列化的对象上。

span.span: Determines whether the is positioned on an object that can be deserialized.

returns.span: 如果正确定位了读取器，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the reader is positioned correctly; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法检查是否将读取器定位在可反序列化的元素上，如果是，则返回 `true`。This method checks whether the reader is positioned on an element that can be deserialized, and returns `true` if it is. 若要返回 `true`，找到的元素必须具有预期的名称。To return `true`, the found element must have the expected name.

summary.span: 获取序列化程序通过一次读取或写入调用在对象图中序列化或反序列化的最大项数。

span.span: Gets the maximum number of items in an object graph that the serializer serializes or deserializes in one read or write call.

value.span: 要序列化或反序列化的最大项数。

span.span: The maximum number of items to serialize or deserialize.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用构造函数来设置此属性。This property can be set using a constructor. 有关列表，请参见 。For a list, see . 属性指定序列化程序在一次 或 方法调用中序列化或反序列化的对象的最大数目。The property specifies the maximum number of objects that the serializer serializes or deserializes in a single or method call. 该方法总是读取一个根对象，但此对象的数据成员中可以具有其他对象。The method always reads one root object, but this object may have other objects in its data members. 这些对象又可以具有其他对象。Those objects may have other objects. 默认值为 。The default is . 请注意，当序列化或反序列化数组时，每个数组项都计为一个单独的对象。Note that when serializing or deserializing arrays, every array entry counts as a separate object. 还应注意，一些对象可能具有较大内存表示形式，因此，仅靠此配额可能不足以防范拒绝服务攻击。Also, note that some objects may have a large memory representation, so this quota alone may not be sufficient to prevent Denial of Service attacks. 有关详细信息，请参阅 [数据的安全注意事项](/dotnet/framework/wcf/feature-details/security-considerations-for-data)。For more information, see [Security Considerations for Data](/dotnet/framework/wcf/feature-details/security-considerations-for-data). 如果需要增加此配额以至超出默认值，则一定要在发送（序列化）和接收（反序列化）方同时增加此配额。If you need to increase this quota beyond its default value, it is important to do so both on the sending (serializing) and receiving (deserializing) sides. 这同时适用于数据读取和写入。It applies both when reading and writing data.

exception.span: 项数超出了最大值。

span.span: The number of items exceeds the maximum value.

summary.span: 使用 写入开始 XML 元素，以便将对象序列化为可映射到 JavaScript 对象表示法 (JSON) 的 XML。

span.span: Writes the opening XML element for serializing an object to XML that can be mapped to JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) using an .
